channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Pen Farthing team 'turned away' from airport
item.description: The ex-marine has been trying to get rescue animals out of Afghanistan and was near the bomb blasts.

item.title: Tom Cruise's BMW stolen during Mission: Impossible filming
item.description: The BMW X7 was stolen from Church Street, Birmingham, near to the hotel where the actor was staying.

item.title: Harry Dunn: Second anniversary of death 'holds more dread'
item.description: Charlotte Charles says the second anniversary of her son's death holds a "bit more dread".

item.title: Morecambe and Wise 'bored stiff' by Monty Python
item.description: The comedy double act shared their thoughts in an unearthed 1973 interview for a student TV station.

item.title: Shoreditch assault: Metal whipped cream dispenser used in racist attack
item.description: Police want help to identify three men who carried out an unprovoked racially motivated attack.

item.title: Moor walker fell 200ft down ravine
item.description: Imran Choudhury spent three weeks in an induced coma after breaking his skull, spine and leg.

item.title: Kingswinford: Car reached 96mph before crash that killed four
item.description: A Skoda Fabia, driven by Joshua Parkes ploughed through a lamppost and hit a tree, an inquest hears.

item.title: Man charged with contaminating supermarket goods
item.description: The 37-year-old was held after incidents at three stores in west London on Wednesday evening.

item.title: 'I want to cycle without the fear of being hurt'
item.description: A new safety campaign hopes to remind drivers there is a real person behind every cyclist.

item.title: Benjamin Mendy: Manchester City footballer charged with rape
item.description: Defender Benjamin Mendy is charged with four counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

item.title: Man arrested over dogs stolen from Spondon kennels
item.description: A man, in his 20s, is arrested after three pets, including a therapy dog, were taken from kennels.

item.title: Bournemouth park busker pinned to floor by police
item.description: Videos of the incident show the busker's face covered in blood after being forced to the floor.

item.title: 'Shocking' Hull A63 crossing attempt caught on CCTV
item.description: Footage shows the man squeezing through the central reservation as traffic passes just feet away.

item.title: Hundreds of fish die after huge Coventry warehouse fire
item.description: An investigation is probing whether water run-off from the warehouse blaze polluted a nearby lake.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Maisie Summers-Newton's family 'proud' of gold medal
item.description: Maisie, 19, has "done us all and herself proud," says mum as she claims a medal in Tokyo.

item.title: Cheshire man cycling 274 miles after brain tumour recovery
item.description: Darren Buckley is cycling the distance which represents 10% of Brain Tumour Research's daily costs.

item.title: Worcestershire NHS managers knew cancers missed due to X-ray backlog
item.description: For years an NHS trust in Worcestershire had a backlog of thousands of unchecked X-ray results.

item.title: Isle of Man: Cargo ship freed in overnight operation
item.description: A ship which became stranded on the Isle of Man has been freed after a second rescue attempt.

item.title: Nottingham cyclist left with footprint on head after attack
item.description: Police are looking for two men who were riding an electric scooter in the area at the time.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root's third century in three Tests punishes tourists
item.description: England captain Joe Root continues his stellar form with yet another magnificent century to flatten India on day two of the third Test at Headingley.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Kadeena Cox sets new world record to win gold
item.description: British star Kadeena Cox sets a new world record to retain her C4-5 500m time trial title at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Chris Jordan and Phil Salt: Surrey & Lancashire to sign Sussex pair for 2022
item.description: England internationals Chris Jordan and Phil Salt are to leave Sussex and sign for Surrey and Lancashire respectively at the end of the season.
